item.title: First Voyage raises $2.5M for its AI companion that helps you build habits
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: First Voyage has raised $2.5 million in a seed funding round from a16z speedrun, SignalFire, True Global, and other investors.

item.title: Mirelo raises $41M from Index and a16z to solve AI video’s silent problem
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Mirelo, a German startup that is building AI to add synced sound effects to videos, has raised a $41 million seed round led by Index Ventures and Andreessen Horowitz.

item.title: Thea Energy previews Helios, its pixel-inspired fusion power plant
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Thea Energy says that its planar-coil fusion power plant could be cheaper and easier to build thanks to AI-powered control software.

item.title: Mesa shuts down credit card that rewarded cardholders for paying their mortgages
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Fintech startup Mesa has shut down its Homeowners Card, which awarded points to cardholders for paying their mortgages.

item.title: India’s Spinny lines up $160M funding to acquire GoMechanic, sources say
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Spinny is set to be valued at about $1.8 billion post-money in its latest funding round.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Kate Park, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2025.

item.title: Netflix growing up, data center jet engines, and the circular AI economy
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Anthony Ha, Kirsten Korosec
item.description: A baby was born in a Waymo this week, and it wasn’t even the first one.  What started as a novelty story quickly became a reminder of how autonomous vehicles are quietly becoming part of everyday life, complete with all the messiness that entails. The real coming-of-age story this week, however, wasn’t happening in San Francisco’s robotaxis. It was playing […]

item.title: Retro, a photo-sharing app for friends, lets you ‘time-travel’ through your camera roll
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Retro's new feature, Rewind, lets you look back at your photo memories and scroll through them with a dial.

item.title: 1X struck a deal to send its ‘home’ humanoids to factories and warehouses
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Despite launching as a humanoid robot designed to help consumers around the house, 1X's Neo robots are heading to industrial use cases.

item.title: The market has ‘switched’ and founders have the power now, VCs say
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Maggie Nye
item.description: Graham & Walker’s Leslie Feinzaig and XYZ Venture’s Ross Fubini share the secrets for founders — and VCs — to make the most of the current fast pace of dealmaking.

item.title: What most VCs won’t tell you about raising capital
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Venture capitalists Ross Fubini (XYZ Ventures) and Leslie Feinzaig (Graham & Walker Ventures) pull back the curtain on how VCs build their own go-to-market strategies — not just how they evaluate startups, but also how they win over LPs and founders alike. In this episode of Build Mode, they share hard-won lessons from raising their […]

item.title: On Me raises $6M to shake up the gift card industry
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: On Me raises $6 million for its digital gift card platform that lets users purchase cards categorized by interests rather than being restricted to specific retailers.

item.title: Eclipse Energy’s microbes can turn idle oil wells into hydrogen factories
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The biotech startup is betting that owners of abandoned oil wells will use the tech to squeeze energy out of their wells.

item.title: Interest in Spoor’s bird-monitoring AI software is soaring
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Spoor's computer vision software can help wind farms, and other industries, track bird populations and migration patterns.

item.title: Port raises $100M at $800M valuation to take on Spotify’s Backstage
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Port offers a proprietary alternative to Spotify's popular devtool catalog Backstage, but with a valuable addition — it can be used to manage AI agents, too.

item.title: Runware raises $50M Series A to help make image, video generation easier for developers
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Runware lets developers integrate real-time image generation in their apps, with an affordable pricing model.

item.title: Harness hits $5.5B valuation with $240M raise to automate AI’s ‘after-code’ gap
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Goldman Sachs has led Harness's Series E round, with participation from IVP, Menlo Ventures, and Unusual Ventures.

item.title: Capital is a commodity (but your investor relationships aren’t)
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Venture capitalists Ross Fubini (XYZ Ventures) and Leslie Feinzaig (Graham & Walker Ventures) pull back the curtain on how VCs build their own go-to-market strategies — not just how they evaluate startups, but also how they win over LPs and founders alike. In this episode of Build Mode, they share hard-won lessons from raising their first funds and how that experience allows […]

item.title: Overview Energy wants to beam energy from space to existing solar farms
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The stealthy startup plans to use a network of satellites to harvest sunlight and send it to Earth using infrared lasers.

item.title: ElevenLabs just hit a $6.6B valuation. Its CEO says the real money isn’t in voice anymore.
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: ElevenLabs has made a name for itself building realistic AI voices.   What started as two Polish engineers annoyed by terrible movie dubbing has grown into a profitable company now valued at $6.6 billion, doubling from just nine months ago. The company recently announced a $100 million tender offer led by Sequoia and ICONIQ, with participation from a16z […]
